summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 discussing the coordination and status of uploading digital evidence (from devices with NYC evidence numbers) related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Relativity e-discovery platform. It involves questions about missing files, duplicate folders, zero-byte files, and devices requiring hardware recovery.

persons.name: Francesco
persons.role: Potential point of contact for evidence coordination
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who might assist with outstanding evidence questions if the primary contact is unavailable.

events.title: Evidence Status Update
events.description: An email provides updates on evidence processing, confirming supplemental files should be ignored, zero-byte files are a normal software artifact, and that some devices require hardware recovery due to physical failure.

events.title: Evidence Spreadsheet Update
events.description: An updated, color-coded spreadsheet of evidence items is provided, indicating five items still pending for delivery.

keyFacts: The communication centers on managing digital evidence for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, specifically uploading materials to the Relativity platform.
Multiple devices are referenced by NYC evidence numbers (e.g., NYC024332, NYC024369, NYC027913), indicating a large volume of seized digital material.
There are issues with evidence completeness, including a missing device (NYC027913), duplicate folders, and approximately 71,000 zero-byte (empty) files in initial extractions.
Some devices (e.g., servers with multiple drives) are noted as physically failed and require specialized hardware recovery, which is described as a potentially long and uncertain process.
The emails show a back-and-forth between legal/technical teams to verify inventory and ensure all discovery materials are processed correctly.
